author: stefano
msg: fixed deprecation

author: stefano
msg: Changed the names of the attributes to reflect the original command line ones.
WARNING: this might break compatibility so you want to check
the new attributes names if you are using the Javadoc2 task.
(jon, might be your case).
Sorry for this, but I think it's better to have the same names on the
command line and on the XML file, even if this breaks java
naming conventions.

author: stefano
msg: added XSLT task (you need Xalan.jar in your classpath for running, but not for compilation :) reflection trick :)

author: jons
msg: added in Tim's code. note that i needed to make
some minor modifications to get it to compile. these modifications
were limited to changing lines like this:
byte foo = ' ';
to
byte foo = new Byte(" ").byteValue();
there is probably a better way to do this, but this should
work just fine anyways.

author: costin
msg: - added a generic script to run ant.
Assuming you install ant somewhere on your system, you can
do a ln -s .../ant/bin/ant ~/bin and use "ant" command instead
of build.sh ( like you use make :-)
- added "dist" target to create an ant "package" ( with bin, lib, doc :-),
and "package" to create a distribution ( a zip file in ftp dir )
(same is in work for tomcat)
A bat file is needed...
